alert.note: Alert for Adjuntas; Lares; Utuado (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 4:22PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by strong thunderstorms with excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Adjuntas, Lares and Utuado. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Quick rises along rivers and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms continue. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Adjuntas, Utuado, Lares and Cayuco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
